item.title: playerCommand
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Well arguments are totally different strings so those are unaffected the only string you cannot keep changing is the command string you can only set it how you want at the beggining and than all the cases are called if that string is equal to what you set.

For example.

[code=java5]switch(args[0].toLowercase()) { //args[0] is the command and i’m putting it all in lowercase

case “npc”:
spawn(args[1], location);
break;[/code]

Read full topic

Can you show an example?

item.title: playerCommand
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:12, topic:545065”][quote author=Dan0194 link=topic=663943.msg4437894#msg4437894 date=1405666543]

people gotta start using the switch statement for strings now looks so much better.

How is switch better? Can you do things such as startsWith or substring? I’m genuinely curious.

The switch is faster. For commands which are pretty simple and you should always being checking if it is equal too it works well but for more complex situations it’s not that good.

[code=java5]switch(PUT ANY STRING HERE) {

case THIS_IS_EQUAL_TO_STRING:
break;

}[/code]

so you can do all that stuff before but not for individual commands.
[/quote]

Well, the majoriy of commands I use have more than one argument, such as item and npc for example.[/quote]

you can still use arguments.

Read full topic

item.title: playerCommand
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. You don’t need that whole && playerCommand.charAt(4) == ’ ') it’s pretty useless and is basically saying if the command entered was “kick” and there was a space after it
  2. You may want to check if you have something like
if (player.rights == 1) {
    // ...
    // Moderator commands
    if (playerCommand.equals("kick")) {
    
    }
}
else if (player.rights == 2) {
    // admin commands
}

Read full topic

item.title: playerCommand
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:

[quote=“Doing Cho2, post:5, topic:545065”][quote author=Bl3nd link=topic=663943.msg4437789#msg4437789 date=1405636252]
If you didn’t look at your other post: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,663908.0.html

It is the same concept as for this command
[/quote]
I know that, but there is no “if(playerCommand.startsWith(“jail”) && c.playerRights == ##) {” there are all…[/quote]

Exactly! Usually there would be if the person who added it didnt want other people using it. Either they didnt want to put a limit on it or they have it under a method called moderator or administrator. But if you want it to have a limit why dont you put one yourself?

Read full topic

item.title: playerCommand
item.dc:creator: @Doing_Cho21 Doing Cho2
item.description:
@Doing_Cho21 wrote:

[sub] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“kick”) && playerCommand.charAt(4) == ’ ') {
try {
String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5);
for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
Server.playerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true;
}
}
}
} catch(Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Player Must Be Offline.”);
}
}[/sub]
How do I tell what person has the power to do that command? Is it from playerCommand.charAt(4)?

Read full topic
